{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Symbolic aggregate approximation\n",
    "\n",
    "In this example, we will explore the SAX transformation. Which discretizes a time\n",
    "series into bins and assign those bins a letter."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import matplotlib.pylab as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "from wildboar.datasets import load_dataset\n",
    "from wildboar.transform import SAX\n",
    "from wildboar.utils.plot import plot_time_domain"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "First, we load a dataset. Note that we preprocess the dataset using the ``minmax_scale`` function so that each time series no longer is normalized with zero mean and unit standard deviation."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "x, y = load_dataset(\"TwoLeadECG\", preprocess=\"minmax_scale\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Next, we define a SAX transformer object. Since SAX is stateless, we do not have to call ``fit`` on the estimator. The ``SAX`` estimator implicitly sets the ``estimate`` parameter to true so that the parameters for SAX are estimated for each sample."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "transform = SAX(window=4, n_bins=4)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "x_sax = transform.fit_transform(x)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "[<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x7f80f8a684f0>]"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 5,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 576x432 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, figsize=(8, 6))\n",
    "ax[0].plot(np.repeat(x_sax[0], 4, axis=0))\n",
    "ax[1].plot(x[0])"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "If we set ``estimate=False``, the results are incorrect unless we standardize the time series."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "transform.set_params(estimate=False)\n",
    "x_sax = transform.fit_transform(x)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "[<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x7f80c8e12b20>]"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 7,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 576x432 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, figsize=(8, 6))\n",
    "ax[0].plot(np.repeat(x_sax[0], 4, axis=0))\n",
    "ax[1].plot(x[0])"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "However, since the time series are min/max normalized, we can safely use the ``binning=\"uniform\"`` without setting ``estimate=True``."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "transform.set_params(binning=\"uniform\")\n",
    "x_sax = transform.fit_transform(x)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "[<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x7f80b8536850>]"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 9,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 576x432 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, figsize=(8, 6))\n",
    "ax[0].plot(np.repeat(x_sax[0], 4, axis=0))\n",
    "ax[1].plot(x[0])"
   ]
  }
 ],
